reply_text:
Well, there are less clients in most categories, as far as I can see, due to Covid and the implications regarding their business.
Add to that the fact that the number of sellers have doubled, even tripled in some cases. So‚Ä¶ as far as I can see the situation is worse than before Covid, at least in my case.

thread_text: We know every day thousands of people are coming in fiverr but In the COVID-19 situation are they hiring? Now many midlevel companies are started to the online platform which is not seen to do before the COVID-19 situation.
reply_text:
Hello, this is the first time I‚Äôm replying to a post here, but here goes nothing.
I joined Fiverr during the pandemic mostly out of curiosity, I already had a good enough career in freelancing as a writer offline( nothing big just good enough for a student) but on joining the Fiverr community I came to a shocking realisation!
It really wasn‚Äôt easy getting people to notice and trust your gigs. It was also almost impossible to get my offline clients to join Fiverr and order my services.
So I‚Äôm mostly working on convincing my clients to join Fiverr (because I feel it‚Äôs safer ) and also get people to actually order my gigsüòÜ. It‚Äôs not been easy but I have a whole lockdown to keep trying!

frequent_posters: coolbrains, jonbaas, vibronx, danytenerife, developercareer, gina_riley2, luqmanstudio, barrelofmonkeys, gig_freak
thread_text:
strong text
Hi guys , do you still receive tips after a good delivery?
In my case , i win more tips in pandemic times than couple years ago.
Looks like the customers was happy , and will send tips couple bucks more more easily than in the past.
How its your experience about that ? Increase tips $ ?
reply_text: I don‚Äôt work for tips. I work to impress my clients with the work they hire me to complete. If a buyer wants to leave a tip, that is their choice, and I thank them for it, but I neither work for tips, nor expect them.

reply_text:
You ever wonder what the purpose of a tip is on 5r?
In the USA, we tip for just about everything: cab drivers, delivery people (except mail), housekeepers, bartenders, even cashiers at fast food joints may have a tip jar.
Far as I know, 5r is the only freelance site with an aggressive tipping feature. You feel like a cheapskate scumbag when not able to tip.
Some countries have no gratuity, therefore confused when pushed to do so after closing an order. I used to like tipping on a ‚Äúgood deal‚Äù order but I feel like the push-iness of it is a real turn off.
Let‚Äôs not even mention the admin fee.

thread_name: No sales at all, Maybe (COVID-19) is the reason?
thread_text:
First of all, Maybe some of you know me very well because I was a really active user on this forum but then I stopped posting here for some reason. I was busy working on my other projects & for sometime I even stopped working on Fiverr but now I‚Äôm back here. You guys can discuss with me on any topic & If you like fighting on some topics then try me because I don‚Äôt take things personally very easily.
Just kidding
I don‚Äôt know why but I‚Äôm not getting any orders at all. No messages‚Ä¶ Nothing
Maybe Coronavirus is the culprit because mostly all of my buyers are from USA. Recently one buyer told me that work is very very slow here in the US.
Today POTUS (Donald Trump) declares national emergency to combat Coronavirus so I don‚Äôt think my sales will get any better in next few days. Recently, I watched this Australian news channel where 2 ladies are fighting for a toilet paper & I was like ***.
I even contacted Fiverr Support team today & they responded:
‚ÄúFiverr does not guarantee impressions, clicks or views for your Gig. We provide a marketplace for you to advertise your Gigs, and it is up to you to make them appealing, and promote them outside of Fiverr to increase the number of views your Gig receives.‚Äù
Typical Fiverr response
What do you think guys??
reply_text:
My inbox went dead on Thursday (was it when the state of emergency was declared?) Then I got an order that was canceled before the requirements were even submitted because the event the project was for was canceled. I‚Äôm already at nearly 50% of my monthly revenue now so it could be worse, I suppose.
Fiverr obviously can‚Äôt force people into spending money or committing to new projects when they‚Äôd much rather panic or just reschedule things and restructure budgets until we get a clearer picture of where all of this is going.

What do you think guys??
reply_text: Hi now is a very hard times for all of us and we should think in a way to help each others in this period many offices and businesses are stop working and there is very few people in a streets. And because of pandemic there isn‚Äôt much to do now it‚Äôs time to hold and rethink our actions, if you don‚Äôt have orders you can always sharpen your skills, I don‚Äôt like your sarcastic notice about fiverr‚Äôs answer, as fiverr do a lot to make this platform best possible place for all of us by promoting and attracting as many customers as it‚Äôs possible. So what we do with our work to support fiverr‚Äôs growth? I can‚Äôt understand people who think that fiverr owe them anything. Can I ask you why you don‚Äôt have buyers? Why you don‚Äôt make them return? You need to provide the best possible work to make them forget about other places, you must give them quality that they will not get in other places I‚Äôm not speaking about price believe me if you have money you will buy a Porsche rather than Fiat if you know what I mean so every customer ready to pay for a good product as they understand that with that they will look better and can success, every time lowering prices and giving even low quality product isn‚Äôt the way we should try to keep on fiverr. I recommend to read more and study better to become a better skilled in what you do every time you have a time this is the only way to attract more customers. In these days the whole world is fighting with unseen virus which is not a joke and because of massive isolation it‚Äôs very natural that everything will loose the grip and become more slow so imagine if every seller who have a drop on sales will message to fiverr and ask why they aren‚Äôt get as many orders as they want? I have printed flyers and hire 2 girls to share them with people I buy a places to make advertisements I go to different forums and workshops I meet people and tell about my business on fiverr I try to advertise as much as I can my gigs. I‚Äôm not a specialist in this maybe I do many wrong things but I try at least I don‚Äôt seat and ask fiverr to give me a buyers I have a buyers outside of fiverr I invite them I recommend them to use fiverr I‚Äôm an artist designer I never do marketing I don‚Äôt understand much and it costs me a lot of energy and I feel not comfortable doing that many things but I know that if each of us will try to do something which will help fiverr that will be only good for all of us. Sorry if I write anything wrong or anyhow you can think I offend in any case please don‚Äôt take this personal I just speak in general it‚Äôs about my feelings and thoughts which I follow, you can give me your opinion and I can learn from it much, thank you and stay safe we all should try to pass through this with understanding and compassion to each other stay safe

thread_name: No sales at all, Maybe (COVID-19) is the reason?
thread_text:
First of all, Maybe some of you know me very well because I was a really active user on this forum but then I stopped posting here for some reason. I was busy working on my other projects & for sometime I even stopped working on Fiverr but now I‚Äôm back here. Today POTUS (Donald Trump) declares national emergency to combat Coronavirus so I don‚Äôt think my sales will get any better in next few days. Recently, I watched this Australian news channel where 2 ladies are fighting for a toilet paper & I was like ***.
I even contacted Fiverr Support team today & they responded:
‚ÄúFiverr does not guarantee impressions, clicks or views for your Gig. We provide a marketplace for you to advertise your Gigs, and it is up to you to make them appealing, and promote them outside of Fiverr to increase the number of views your Gig receives.‚Äù
Typical Fiverr response
What do you think guys??
reply_text:
First of all, Please accept my deepest condolence. Recently, Armenia reports first death related to coronavirus which is pretty sad
You‚Äôre right, If I‚Äôm not getting any orders then there is something wrong with me. Maybe my gigs, images, title, keywords & my skills are not not working for me. I will change them & improve my gigs & skills soon. But please note: I‚Äôm not bashing Fiverr here & I‚Äôm not complaining about not getting orders
I started this discussion to verify that if (COVID-19) is the reason for not getting any sales right now. And yes I was right. (This Coronavirus pandemic changed the world including Fiverr) Usually I receive 5-6 messages per day or sometimes 2-3 orders a day. But from last 26 days, No one is contacting me & no one is ordering my gigs which was pretty strange for me that‚Äôs why I started this.
Repeat customers are the reason of my survival on Fiverr. I‚Äôm a seller here for more than 6 years now so yeah I know what I‚Äôm doing here. I often advertise & promote my gigs on different platforms & yes on on my social media accounts as well. I even have a ‚ÄúMarketing budget‚Äù for my gigs. Yes, I usually invest my 20% earning on advertising which is essential for my online business. When I‚Äôve started in 2014 the competition for me was not that strong. Yes ‚ÄúMy Main Job was to speed up wordpress sites much faster‚Äù & that time no one was competing with me.
You can go to Fiverr & just search this: wordpress speed optimization (You will find 100+ gigs about speed optimization) Yeah exactly like the logo ones. Everyone is a expert in this field now I‚Äôm talking about wordpress speed optimization here.
2014 (When I was just 18-19 years old kid) 2020 (When I‚Äôm 24 right now & much for experienced & professional)
So yeah I improved a lot & yes even my personal life is changed now
I stopped working here for more than 2 years because of some personal reasons but when I started again in 2019 everything about this marketplace was changed. Fiverr PRO area, You can take skills & other tests. So I was happy that they‚Äôre improving this marketplace but then I activated the paused gigs & realized that no one is messaging me. I searched my gigs & found out that every other seller is offering my services, which was just shocking for me. I invested my time & money on my profile & then orders start coming again. I even messaged my previous buyers so they can know that I‚Äôm back here
Everything was normal that time then in January 2020 my impressions, views & clicks were decreasing every single day. (Strange) right!!
I contacted Fiverr support & they told me that everything is fine with your account but I still told them to check it again & they replied: Everything is normal but I can feel that everything was not normal that time. February was a pretty good month for me but then this March month destroyed everything
I can‚Äôt even express my feelings with you, I‚Äôm so sad & worried right now. & please don‚Äôt say sorry to me & yeah I don‚Äôt take anything personally so don‚Äôt worry
Stay home, stay safe

thread_text:
First of all, Maybe some of you know me very well because I was a really active user on this forum but then I stopped posting here for some reason. Today POTUS (Donald Trump) declares national emergency to combat Coronavirus so I don‚Äôt think my sales will get any better in next few days. Recently, I watched this Australian news channel where 2 ladies are fighting for a toilet paper & I was like ***.
I even contacted Fiverr Support team today & they responded:
‚ÄúFiverr does not guarantee impressions, clicks or views for your Gig. We provide a marketplace for you to advertise your Gigs, and it is up to you to make them appealing, and promote them outside of Fiverr to increase the number of views your Gig receives.‚Äù
Typical Fiverr response
What do you think guys??
reply_text:
wpfalcon:
No no, Please try to understand that main purpose was to show the impact of the coronavirus on businesses.
To be honest, I am getting sick of people trying to remind me of the impact on businesses. I have a friend who secured the lease on a restaurant just before this. He was due to open in a few days, can‚Äôt, and is still contractually obliged to pay $1,200 rent each month for the next year.
I know a couple who own a shop who can‚Äôt open and are stuck in a similar boat with no income coming in.
I use a mobile grocer to buy my groceries who is now no longer able to do his rounds, and the last time he was here last week, there was a pretty depressed guy I know asking how many individual eggs he could buy with what change he had.
I live on a street of bar and restaurant workers, none of whom are going to be able to pay their rent very soon. Any who are foreign have also been told that if they do not have jobs or are not economically self sufficient, they will need to go back to their own countries by the government. - Despite the only airport being closed.
Now it seems like every time I come here, I have someone I do not know from Adam asking me to help them out, think of them, or do something to help fight Covid-19 by donating my time or skills for free to nondescript charitable causes.
I‚Äôm very sorry that you are experiencing hardship. However, like it or not, nobody here can help. It is really as simple as that and the worst thing you can do is continue going around in circles asking people to care or help. Instead, you need to figure out how to help yourself.
Sorry to be brutal, but that‚Äôs the way it is. .

reply_text:
cyaxrex:
every time I come here, I have someone I do not know from Adam asking me to help them out, think of them, or do something to help fight Covid-19 by donating my time or skills for free
For me this adds to the overall sense of doom despair and utter hopelessness when I read these. Fiverr is a place of professionals, or it is supposed to be at least. It makes me feel nauseated to read posts saying sellers should help other sellers and buy their gigs just to help them.
Fiverr is my bright light of hope, enthusiasm, and enjoyment of being able to act as a self employed professional and I don‚Äôt want that to be ruined by seeing outright begging by sellers.

I even contacted Fiverr Support team today & they responded:
‚ÄúFiverr does not guarantee impressions, clicks or views for your Gig. We provide a marketplace for you to advertise your Gigs, and it is up to you to make them appealing, and promote them outside of Fiverr to increase the number of views your Gig receives.‚Äù
Typical Fiverr response
What do you think guys??
reply_text:
wpfalcon:
I‚Äôm a reputed & experienced seller here & a member for more than 6 years now
I get that. Also, I am sincerely sorry that you are in a tight spot. However, to be very blunt, a lot of people are and things are only going to get worse. In this case, you need to start thinking outside the box.
People and businesses in your area will be struggling right now. Is it possible that you could help by reaching out to them directly and offering budget-friendly wen development,graphic design, or marketing services, even if you outsource some of these?
You would literally just have to send a letters to each one. (No one reads emails, but letters can still work.)
That is just one basic idea that may not be applicable to you at all, but you need to start looking for solutions like that yourself. You could also play ith your pricing a little. Lower the price of your most pricey web design gig, but increase the price of your $10 gigs.
Maybe also re-evaluate your delivery times. No offense, but I don‚Äôt believe you can build me a full, fully responsive website in 2-days. Maybe create a 1-day consultation gig or package, and increase delivery time on your web design gig to something like 5-days.
Whatever you do, good luck. However, you really do need to start with you doing something, rather than asking for people to share their excess orders with you. Quite frankly, most people likely don‚Äôt have excess orders to start with.

First of all, Maybe some of you know me very well because I was a really active user on this forum but then I stopped posting here for some reason. I was busy working on my other projects & for sometime I even stopped working on Fiverr but now I‚Äôm back here. You guys can discuss with me on any topic & If you like fighting on some topics then try me because I don‚Äôt take things personally very easily.
Just kidding
I don‚Äôt know why but I‚Äôm not getting any orders at all. No messages‚Ä¶ Nothing
Maybe Coronavirus is the culprit because mostly all of my buyers are from USA. Recently one buyer told me that work is very very slow here in the US.
Today POTUS (Donald Trump) declares national emergency to combat Coronavirus so I don‚Äôt think my sales will get any better in next few days. Recently, I watched this Australian news channel where 2 ladies are fighting for a toilet paper & I was like ***.
I even contacted Fiverr Support team today & they responded:
‚ÄúFiverr does not guarantee impressions, clicks or views for your Gig. We provide a marketplace for you to advertise your Gigs, and it is up to you to make them appealing, and promote them outside of Fiverr to increase the number of views your Gig receives.‚Äù
Typical Fiverr response
What do you think guys??
reply_text: no order ,no new buyer. I think this is due to this deadly virus.

reply_text:
I‚Äôm still working on that site, If you have a URL then you can visit it but I can show some screenshots here. Actually many forum members & Fiverr staff members appreciated me but they also told me this: Don‚Äôt share any link here or anywhere on Fiverr.
Actually I respect them & that‚Äôs why I decided to stay quite until it‚Äôs done. Yes my (2 day launch) idea was bad because my friends told me that we can‚Äôt publish this huge site in just next few days. Yes, I decided to launch that campaign in next 15 days. Where me & you will help (NON-US Freelancers) in need.
I will advertise it on Google ads, Facebook & other social media channels. I don‚Äôt have enough budget right now but I can assure you that we will start this (Relief fund) even without any enough resources.
In next few months NON-US freelancer can create an account & start their own Unions. I will start my own Forum for freelancers & a Huge NON-US Freelancers Union website. 100 & 100 of pages, Forum, Support, Blog, Donate now & other things included.
What Fiverr team told me:
Greetings, you do not need to promote your site and post URL everywhere. talk about it, increase awareness of it and the need for such union. Anyone can build the website, but the whole point is not the traffic or number of members on the site but the act, will and sacrifice for other colleagues. Don‚Äôt ask to post the link but to start a topic and discussion to hear other freelancers, what they need the most, how do they feel and what each of you can contribute.

reply_text:
wpfalcon:
If you‚Äôre a NON-US Freelancer who wants some financial help then you will go the website & fill some kind of form where you will provide all the details, reason etc‚Ä¶
You really need to think on your execution. You are missing a lot of points. Let‚Äôs start with the Non-US. Which counties will that be? Do you realise that NON-US also includes Russia, China, South American countries, Australia and all European countries?
Secondly to operate like that you will need to register yourself with a government under a certain licence. Are you working on registering yourself as a charity? Otherwise your website will be nothing but a scam (even if you don‚Äôt think so). You can not register yourself as a sole trader otherwise you will have to pay tax on every donation you get as on normal income. If you are not planning to register yourself then again it will be illegal. + all the points that @jonbaas added.
It might be noble what you are thinking to do but it looks like you are not even realising what work will stand behind that and what will be the process of registering and running it.
Website is actually only a tool. You thought of how to make a tool but you didn‚Äôt think of how to build a ‚Äúhouse‚Äù. E.g you need to build a house and instead of hiring an architect and designer and create plans of how your house will look like and workers to build it, you instead of that hired people to create a hammer because you think the hammer is what will build you a house.
You are missing a big research and planning part.

reply_text:
Yeah I know & thanks for the suggestion. Actually I‚Äôm that kind of person who don‚Äôt even trust such non-profitable or charity organizations.
Then why I decided to make such Union for NON-US Freelancers?
Because we don‚Äôt have it, We don‚Äôt have any security in case of emergencies like (COVID-19) situation right now. Our government is helping businesses, labours, companies but they don‚Äôt have any plans for Independent workers.
We‚Äôre nothing to them?? You know what In ‚ÄúIndia‚Äù banks don‚Äôt give loans to the Freelancers easily. If you have a salary account then the process is easy but for freelancers it‚Äôs pretty tough.
If you‚Äôre a Full time freelancer like me then don‚Äôt expect anything from government, banks & even the society.
Usually I trust only Prime Minister‚Äôs National Relief Fund in my country.

thread_text:

I even contacted Fiverr Support team today & they responded:
‚ÄúFiverr does not guarantee impressions, clicks or views for your Gig. We provide a marketplace for you to advertise your Gigs, and it is up to you to make them appealing, and promote them outside of Fiverr to increase the number of views your Gig receives.‚Äù
Typical Fiverr response
What do you think guys??
reply_text:
wpfalcon:
I‚Äôm that kind of person who don‚Äôt even trust such non-profitable or charity organizations.
In all honesty, what credentials do you have to offer that would make people trust YOU to be the organizer for this ‚Äúfreelance union‚Äù? How do people who might be interested, know that you aren‚Äôt doing this for personal gain, or that there really are funds to be provided? Who are your big-name backers and financial supporters? What security and oversight do you have in mind? What kind of reputation are you building this upon? Have you procured legal standing? Do you have the paperwork that gives your ‚Äúunion‚Äù legitimacy? Are you registered in all of the countries you wish to operate?..
If you don‚Äôt trust charities, why should someone trust YOU to be a charity and purveyor of funds? (I‚Äôm asking, not accusing)
wpfalcon:
We don‚Äôt have any security in case of emergencies like (COVID-19) situation right now. Our government is helping businesses, labours, companies but they don‚Äôt have any plans for Independent workers.
This is the very nature of anyone choosing to be an independent worker. Independence from any corporate banner, and a self-minded approach to offering services is, by nature, supposed to be a risk freelancers take. Smart freelancers plan for tough times. They don‚Äôt put all their eggs in one basket. Freelancers are not unionized, or a cooperative venture. Freelancers take on the responsibility to be their own business ‚Äì to grow their dreams, and become what they want to become. To be successful, means to take on the risk of failure as well. Without the risk of failure, there can be no success.
I admire those who truly wish to help freelancers, but I just don‚Äôt think you‚Äôre going about it in a reasonable, strategic or cooperative way. A union begins as a group of like-minded tradesmen, it isn‚Äôt one person trying to collect money for dubious distribution. I just don‚Äôt feel as though you are thinking this all the way through. You have a grand ‚Äì and noble idea ‚Äì but no practical execution.

Just kidding
I don‚Äôt know why but I‚Äôm not getting any orders at all. No messages‚Ä¶ Nothing
Maybe Coronavirus is the culprit because mostly all of my buyers are from USA. Recently one buyer told me that work is very very slow here in the US.
Today POTUS (Donald Trump) declares national emergency to combat Coronavirus so I don‚Äôt think my sales will get any better in next few days. Recently, I watched this Australian news channel where 2 ladies are fighting for a toilet paper & I was like ***.
I even contacted Fiverr Support team today & they responded:
‚ÄúFiverr does not guarantee impressions, clicks or views for your Gig. We provide a marketplace for you to advertise your Gigs, and it is up to you to make them appealing, and promote them outside of Fiverr to increase the number of views your Gig receives.‚Äù
Typical Fiverr response
What do you think guys??
reply_text:
Currently I‚Äôm focusing on Asian countries & maybe someday Europeans. I‚Äôm not starting a charity organization & please note that I‚Äôm talking about a Union here for Non-US Freelancers.
The Relief fund campaign or Donation page is just a small part of that Union or their website.
Why I decided to build a UNION & a website for NON-US Freelancers?
So they can get all the information & they can ask for help in case of emergencies. I‚Äôll try my best to be 100% legal & I have so many friends who can help me for sure so don‚Äôt worry. (Atleast in my country)
I‚Äôm running a sole proprietorship business right now in my country & If I needed any kind of registration or licence for a (UNION) then I will register that organization for sure
I‚Äôm doing research every single day & yes I‚Äôm thinking big right now

reply_text:
Do not get me wrong but this calls for big disaster if you do not properly plan what you are going to do.
It seems to me that you actually build up your plan here in this forum listening to what everybody says.
Just and idea, did you consider to hire professionals to set up such business? This may bring also initial trust level at least.
I am just worried that you want to play a game that may get out of your control soon.
Here‚Äôs a recent story from my country.
Our government wanted to spend $15 Mio for e-shop with freeways vignettes.
Web developers community said this amount is ridiculous and offered to make it for 10% of that money.
So they collected 40 specialists to develop and build up the site during weekend hackaton.
This group was so eager to show that they can do it in short time for friction of that money and finally they almost did it.
I say almost because just a few hours later after website was live, the site was broken with loss of personal data, cc data and more. Those were professionals but lack of time and proper planning meant failing.
Just be very careful when you think that you have solution for this and that. Are you really sure about it?
Anyway, good luck!

thread_text:
First of all, Maybe some of you know me very well because I was a really active user on this forum but then I stopped posting here for some reason. Today POTUS (Donald Trump) declares national emergency to combat Coronavirus so I don‚Äôt think my sales will get any better in next few days. Recently, I watched this Australian news channel where 2 ladies are fighting for a toilet paper & I was like ***.
I even contacted Fiverr Support team today & they responded:
‚ÄúFiverr does not guarantee impressions, clicks or views for your Gig. We provide a marketplace for you to advertise your Gigs, and it is up to you to make them appealing, and promote them outside of Fiverr to increase the number of views your Gig receives.‚Äù
Typical Fiverr response
What do you think guys??
reply_text:
I‚Äôm planning this for months now. Yes when (COVID-19) pandemic was not even started. I‚Äôm just asking & looking for suggestions here.
Yes I have a small team & I‚Äôm also in contact with many professionals. I even sent many e-mails to different organizations who are working for Independent workers or Freelancers. I want their suggestions, advice & ideas. I‚Äôm just a normal person like you so yes I will face many challenges for sure.
Note: Freelancers Union is also started with just few members and goals to change something in the world of freelancing.
Some FAQs: (Let‚Äôs talk Legal)
So you will register this (Organization) as a Trade Union?
Maybe. Right now I‚Äôm just checking every single aspect because even the official (Freelancers Union) is not affiliated with the AFL-CIO or any other organization that represents workers and negotiates on behalf of their members (workers). So they‚Äôre just a non-profit organization.
So you will register this as a Non-profit organization?
In my country, you can register a (Non-profit organization or NGO/NPO) in three ways. Trust Registration, Society Registration, Section 8 Company Registration (Earlier known as Section 25 Company)
The type of registration you will need depends on the purpose you want to achieve.
Please note that Society and Trust registration is different from business registration. This is because societies, trusts, and NGOS have charitable objectives. On the other hand, a business works only for profit. Therefore, separate laws govern Society and Trust registration. The only exception is a Section 8 company which is governed by the Companies Act, 2013. These entities receive some special tax exemptions and benefits. These benefits are not available to commercial business setups.
Do you have any business plan?
Yes I have a plan so I can achieve my goals. I‚Äôm doing my research right now so I can start this (UNION or Organization) so please make sure that If I start this UNION or NGO/NPO someday then I do have a business plan for it.
Do you have any legal team?
Yes I have a legal team so if I needed any kind of registration then I will contact them for sure. I will pay some huge amount for the registration. Also in case of emergencies the legal representative will help me.
Why Should I Trust You?
I‚Äôm just a normal freelancer like you. Recently I started this topic when my sales were dropped dramatically. Everything is normal now, But from that day I decided to do something for my community. Yes, Not just planning or thinking but to execute it properly. I don‚Äôt want to waste my time on such questions where people were asking me If I‚Äôm doing this for any personal gain. I want to help this community & the Freelancers. Specially the NON-US Freelancers. That‚Äôs why I‚Äôm planning it & I will execute it for sure.
Maybe not today, Next week or Next month but in next few years. So literally no one can stop me right now. I still remember a reply where someone told me that legal things take time so yeah I will wait until it‚Äôs done. I want an organization for (NON-US Freelancers) so I‚Äôll try my best to be 100% legal. Otherwise I will not start this anytime soon.
Why you‚Äôre wasting your precious time on such Organization?
I just want to help this community, That‚Äôs all I want. Maybe someday we have a Union for NON-US Freelancers & I‚Äôm sure everyone wants it so we can help each other
What about funding?
Right now I will spend my own money because I want to start a small organization but yes when our (Organization) will get popular then we will find our supporters. Right now the official (Freelancers Union) has received grants and other support from leading foundations such as the Ford Foundation, John D. and Catherine T. MacArthur Foundation, J.P. Morgan Chase Foundation, New York Community Trust, United Hospital Fund, Rockefeller Family Fund, The Robert Wood Johnson Foundation, The Rockefeller Foundation, New York State Health Foundation, The Prudential Foundation, Partnership Fund for New York City, Ira W. De Camp Foundation and others.
Some posts & pages I liked:
Trade Unions for Freelancers: Is It Even Possible?
Freelancers Union
screenshot-2 (3)
1893√ó902 349 KB
Criticism
Thanks once again, I think I provided every single information now, I am open for suggestions.
THINK BIG. START SMALL

What do you think guys??
reply_text:
Great question!
Things have definitely slowed down in comparison to the last few months and I can only assume it is because of the on-going global pandemic. Try not to stress too much and in the meantime, use this as an opportunity to strengthen and refine your existing brand/image on Fiverr or use it to build a brand new gig altogether.
There is always an opportunity to thrive during times like this but the challenge now is that you need to be extra creative and strategic about your branding, services, customer experience, etc. This is what‚Äôs going to set you apart from your competition when the volume of orders is at a low point.
A few key areas that I would personally focus on, if you haven‚Äôt already would be: Creating unique and engaging gig images or videos, writing clear and concise gig descriptions, and improving/adding to your existing skillset.
I hope this helps someone!
Best of luck to everyone and remember to be safe,
Steve

reply_text: Yes, it has been slow. I had a record sales month in February, and started March off pretty well. I was thinking maybe COVID-19 wouldn‚Äôt impact business as mush as I feared. Then, about 3 weeks ago, new inquiries and orders dried up suddenly- and almost overnight. It makes sense. With the number of businesses and companies shut down, there‚Äôs going to be a decreased need for those places working on projects that would otherwise purchase my services. I‚Äôve still had some new orders trickling in- mostly from repeat buyers. I am thankful for them and am looking forward to things getting back to normal. Best of luck!

I was busy working on my other projects & for sometime I even stopped working on Fiverr but now I‚Äôm back here. You guys can discuss with me on any topic & If you like fighting on some topics then try me because I don‚Äôt take things personally very easily.
Just kidding
I don‚Äôt know why but I‚Äôm not getting any orders at all. No messages‚Ä¶ Nothing
Maybe Coronavirus is the culprit because mostly all of my buyers are from USA. Recently one buyer told me that work is very very slow here in the US.
Today POTUS (Donald Trump) declares national emergency to combat Coronavirus so I don‚Äôt think my sales will get any better in next few days. Recently, I watched this Australian news channel where 2 ladies are fighting for a toilet paper & I was like ***.
I even contacted Fiverr Support team today & they responded:
‚ÄúFiverr does not guarantee impressions, clicks or views for your Gig. We provide a marketplace for you to advertise your Gigs, and it is up to you to make them appealing, and promote them outside of Fiverr to increase the number of views your Gig receives.‚Äù
Typical Fiverr response
What do you think guys??
reply_text: Don‚Äôt worry, Just improve your skills

Today POTUS (Donald Trump) declares national emergency to combat Coronavirus so I don‚Äôt think my sales will get any better in next few days. Recently, I watched this Australian news channel where 2 ladies are fighting for a toilet paper & I was like ***.
I even contacted Fiverr Support team today & they responded:
‚ÄúFiverr does not guarantee impressions, clicks or views for your Gig. We provide a marketplace for you to advertise your Gigs, and it is up to you to make them appealing, and promote them outside of Fiverr to increase the number of views your Gig receives.‚Äù
Typical Fiverr response
What do you think guys??
reply_text:
If you not getting any orders has any connection to Covid, then it‚Äôs most likely that the category you‚Äôre offering your services in is oversaturated. With so many people losing their jobs and looking for alternatives, a lot of new sellers joined the platform.
If you want to receive orders you need to prove yourself among your competition, what makes you stand out compared to the competition? Why should a buyer hire you instead of the hundreds of other sellers offering the same services as you?
If you can‚Äôt find answers to that, maybe looking at a less-saturated niche could work (if there is any demand for it). If you have specific skills that clients these days could need, offer them.

reply_text:
sachinsoni569:
Does that affect my gig ranking?
First of all, there is no such thing as ‚Äúgig ranking‚Äù. The Fiverr search system is a dynamic algorithm. It does not rank by popularity, it organizes results differently ‚Äì for each person ‚Äì according to value to that specific person. Every person looking at the search results will see a different list of gigs, based upon what Fiverr thinks is important to that person searching the results.
That being said, though, yes, any cancellation is likely to affect how the algorithm sees the value of your gig ‚Äì insofar as it relates to people searching for it.
sachinsoni569:
And after all this when I was not getting orders
You don‚Äôt ‚Äúget orders‚Äù, you earn them.
sachinsoni569:
But still I‚Äôm getting very less impressions around 1.5K and 20 clicks in a week.
I‚Äôm little worried and don‚Äôt know what to do to get new orders.
Pretend you have an actual real life store, on a city street somewhere‚Ä¶ how would you get customers into that store? Use those same principles to find and reach out to your Fiverr target customers.

frequent_posters: pixperpoint, fouzia_zakria, zerlina84, english_voice, nongmay, miiila, w3bgrafix, misscrystal, janali, coerdelion
thread_text:
Hi everyone. Hope all of you are safe and healthy. My entire family has been tested positive for covid-19. One family member is in very critical condition who‚Äôs fighting for her life and the rest, including me, are showing mild symptoms. June was going to be my most successful month in terms of numbers of orders and revenue. But with all of this going on in my country and particularity in family, I can‚Äôt focus on my work at all. I have lost the will to work and I just want to spend next few weeks with my family only. I‚Äôm not in a mental condition to deal with my customers and in this situation, money is the last thing I‚Äôm caring for.
Therefore, I have paused my best selling gig for quarantine period at least. My concern is if I get back to work by the end of June, would I continue from the same position or my gig would be de-ranked? I don‚Äôt want to lose my hard earned first page spot due to a very legible reason. Please let me know how worse this hit is going to be. Thanks!
reply_text:
Sorry to hear that
It‚Äôs very possible that your gig will go ‚Äúdown‚Äù after you come back, but then again, I‚Äôve been out of office many times and my account wasn‚Äôt affected. It‚Äôs a matter of luck, I guess, but your health and mental health are more important.
Hope everything turns out ok.

frequent_posters: pixperpoint, fouzia_zakria, zerlina84, english_voice, nongmay, miiila, w3bgrafix, misscrystal, janali, coerdelion
thread_text:
Hi everyone. Hope all of you are safe and healthy. My entire family has been tested positive for covid-19. One family member is in very critical condition who‚Äôs fighting for her life and the rest, including me, are showing mild symptoms. June was going to be my most successful month in terms of numbers of orders and revenue. But with all of this going on in my country and particularity in family, I can‚Äôt focus on my work at all. I have lost the will to work and I just want to spend next few weeks with my family only. I‚Äôm not in a mental condition to deal with my customers and in this situation, money is the last thing I‚Äôm caring for.
Therefore, I have paused my best selling gig for quarantine period at least. My concern is if I get back to work by the end of June, would I continue from the same position or my gig would be de-ranked? I don‚Äôt want to lose my hard earned first page spot due to a very legible reason. Please let me know how worse this hit is going to be. Thanks!
reply_text:
Sorry to read that. I fear nobody can tell you how bad the hit for your ranking might be; some people post that they experience long slump periods after breaks, others say it picks up again soon for them. Chances are that your gig will be de-ranked, as Fiverr wants to show buyers active gigs, obviously, (or even because of normal gig rotation), so I think it‚Äôs unprobable that you would continue from the same position if your gig is inactive for two weeks or longer, but how bad it will be/how long it will take to rank higher again, your guess is as good as anybody else‚Äôs.
However, half of June is over already, and as you say it was your best month yet, and it‚Äôs just two weeks until end of June, and money is the last thing you care for, maybe just do it and take care of your family and yourself those two weeks, especially if a family member is in critical condition, but that‚Äôs something you have to decide for yourself.
In any case, though, if you feel you‚Äôre having a mental breakdown, press pause ASAP.
All the best to your whole family!

frequent_posters: pixperpoint, fouzia_zakria, zerlina84, english_voice, nongmay, miiila, w3bgrafix, misscrystal, janali, coerdelion
thread_text:
Hi everyone. Hope all of you are safe and healthy. My entire family has been tested positive for covid-19. One family member is in very critical condition who‚Äôs fighting for her life and the rest, including me, are showing mild symptoms. June was going to be my most successful month in terms of numbers of orders and revenue. But with all of this going on in my country and particularity in family, I can‚Äôt focus on my work at all. I have lost the will to work and I just want to spend next few weeks with my family only. I‚Äôm not in a mental condition to deal with my customers and in this situation, money is the last thing I‚Äôm caring for.
Therefore, I have paused my best selling gig for quarantine period at least. My concern is if I get back to work by the end of June, would I continue from the same position or my gig would be de-ranked? I don‚Äôt want to lose my hard earned first page spot due to a very legible reason. Please let me know how worse this hit is going to be. Thanks!
reply_text: Wow. Good to hear that.

thread_name: How has Coronavirus impacted your Fiverr orders
frequent_posters: the_mad_duck, ash_shahin, mr_tusar, richardfmendes, joyustcian, coerdelion, heyfellow1, judielopes, misscrystal, video_vision
thread_text:
I‚Äôm sure many of you have been impacted by Coronavirus in different ways. Hopefully, you are good health, practicing social distancing, and hoping to see the tail-end of this madness soon.
I decided to take a break from Fiverr for a bit after working in Level 2 for a few years and paused my account. Unfortunately, this impacted my rating and I was downgraded to level 1. Recently, I noticed an email from Fiverr upgrading me to Level 2 status again and I thought, Hey man, that‚Äôs pretty cool. So here I am. Back in business.
Please share your stories of encouragement. I‚Äôm sure we could all benefit from this.
Go Team!

I decided to take a break from Fiverr for a bit after working in Level 2 for a few years and paused my account. Unfortunately, this impacted my rating and I was downgraded to level 1. Recently, I noticed an email from Fiverr upgrading me to Level 2 status again and I thought, Hey man, that‚Äôs pretty cool. So here I am. Back in business.
Please share your stories of encouragement. I‚Äôm sure we could all benefit from this.
Go Team!
reply_text: My career on fiverr started with the help of covid‚Ä¶People were staying at home, using more chatting apps and gaming apps ( discord in my case) etc, thus ordering my service. So its not all bad haha

thread_text: I was running the company many years ago. But since the arrival of COVID, the staff could not be retained due to not being paid properly. The company is on the verge of closing down. I don‚Äôt know what will happen but I am hopeful that my company will make a name for itself on Fiverr.

thread_name: Got covid-19 and was in ICU gig disappeared after 17th order cancellation
frequent_posters: muztre, emily_articles1, pythagoras8pi, misscrystal, anika09, mofeoduntan, tisattia1, gunawanguan
thread_text: From beging of August i got covid-19 positive and admitted in hospital with serious condition and also was in ICU. I was in hospital for last 22 days and also almost all of clients cancelled their work because of my absence total cancelled work is 17th. And also oder completion rate, response , on time delivery rate dropped too. And suddenly my gig disappeared from first page and also lost fiverr choice title . I cant find the gig nowhere . World is suffering but why fiverr dont supporting the sellers???
reply_text: Hi, I‚Äôm glad you are getting well! As to how fiverr works, in an emergency situation unfortunately there are no allowances made.

reply_text:
Good to hear that you made full recovery! That‚Äôs enough good news. You can always build your Fiverr account back with time.
First, reach out to the clients that canceled their orders, explain the situation. I‚Äôm sure some of them will be happy to place the canceled orders back.
Secondly, reach out to Fiverr support with any proof of what happened to you. They might be sympathetic enough to help you reset your account stats.
However, the most important point is to take your recovery from COVID-19 as a major win! And continue basking in the euphoria, till you get your Fiverr account back in shape. Stay safe

thread_name: Isolation stress, can‚Äôt buy masks or sanitizer either!
frequent_posters: misscrystal, coerdelion, honeyhiphop, luzhan, jonbaas, arty182925, lenasemenkova, mariashtelle1, devamos283, vickiespencer, yarasin, vasilikit152, saqibhussain516, md_cbd
thread_text:
hey, I have been having to buy groceries for my whole family as they are in isolation due to coming back from overseas, in Australia anyone returning must self isolate for 14 days. It‚Äôs stressful because the grocery store stopped doing deliveries as they couldn‚Äôt cope with the demand. At the same time you can‚Äôt buy masks or hand sanitizer or rubbing alcohol ANYWHERE! I am just praying for everyone who may be going through something like this, or anything related to COVID-19.
STAY BLESSED, POSITIVE AND SAFE!
reply_text:
honeyhiphop:
hand sanitizer or rubbing alcohol ANYWHERE
I am still surprised that people hoarding hand sanitizers but stores are still full of soaps.
Soaps are more effective than Rubbing alcohol. So it‚Äôs the same effective to wash your hands after going out, just don‚Äôt touch your face during your outings.
honeyhiphop:
At the same time you can‚Äôt buy masks
You don‚Äôt need it if you are healthy, they are useful in this situation only to protect from spreading the virus if you are sick.

thread_name: Isolation stress, can‚Äôt buy masks or sanitizer either!
frequent_posters: misscrystal, coerdelion, honeyhiphop, luzhan, jonbaas, arty182925, lenasemenkova, mariashtelle1, devamos283, vickiespencer, yarasin, vasilikit152, saqibhussain516, md_cbd
thread_text:
hey, I have been having to buy groceries for my whole family as they are in isolation due to coming back from overseas, in Australia anyone returning must self isolate for 14 days. reply_text:
honeyhiphop:
At the same time you can‚Äôt buy masks or hand sanitizer or rubbing alcohol ANYWHERE!
@mariashtelle1 is correct‚Ä¶ most stores may be out of liquid hand sanitizers, but I‚Äôve been seeing plenty of bar soaps. Those are just as good as liquid hand soap. Heck, dish soap should work too ‚Äì I wash my hands in our kitchen sink with dish soap all the time.
The point is to wash your hands with soap and water. Soap comes in many formats.
If you can‚Äôt find medical face masks, use a bandana or a scarf. The point is to stop YOURSELF from potentially spreading the virus. Medical professionals have been saying that, if necessary, bandanas and scarfs are better than nothing.
Don‚Äôt fall into the ‚Äúyou‚Äôve gotta have only this‚Äù hype. A little creativity and common sense will help keep us all safe during these challenging times.

Like other already mention, soaps are great for hands, no matter what type.
But, if you need disinfection for some items (eg. door knobs and anything else), if you don‚Äôt have alcohol ofc, you can use vinegar, or better to say, vinegar+citric acid (it can be lemon if you don‚Äôt have) and water. But, in all of that, vinegar is most important. I know it doesn‚Äôt smell good, but it is good disinfection. I am using it as I couldn‚Äôt find anything else in stores.

It‚Äôs stressful because the grocery store stopped doing deliveries as they couldn‚Äôt cope with the demand. At the same time you can‚Äôt buy masks or hand sanitizer or rubbing alcohol ANYWHERE! I am just praying for everyone who may be going through something like this, or anything related to COVID-19.
STAY BLESSED, POSITIVE AND SAFE!
reply_text:
Hand sanitizer is antibacterial, rather than antiviral. You‚Äôre better washing with soap.
Vinegar and lemon juice are antibacterial. Add Tea Tree essential oil, oregano, thyme and even lavender - all of those are antibacterial, antifungal and antiviral.
You can make your own masks- there are plenty of tutorials on youtube for those with or without sewing machines. It‚Äôs easy ‚Ä¶ but a bit fiddly.
Take a breath, folks - this is going to be with us for some time. Constant stress is bad for the immune system, so breath, do yoga (or whatever) ‚Ä¶ and be open to solutions, not looking for problems ‚Ä¶

Soaps are more effective than Rubbing alcohol.
Shhhhhhh.
Jokes aside, I don‚Äôt think I‚Äôve ever seen a bottle of sanitizer in a store since it all started. They just vanished from existence.
honeyhiphop:
It‚Äôs stressful because the grocery store stopped doing deliveries as they couldn‚Äôt cope with the demand.
Yeah, same here. I did some panic shopping on Saturday, asked the delivery guy how they were doing. He assured me things were under control, people‚Äôs shopping habits haven‚Äôt changed that much and there was no hysteria whatsoever. By Monday the delivery option just magically disappeared from every major grocery store‚Äôs website.
coerdelion:
You can make your own masks- there are plenty of tutorials on youtube for those with or without sewing machines. It‚Äôs easy ‚Ä¶ but a bit fiddly.
That and clothing brands started selling washable masks. They get a bad rep for being useless but one of my Canadian clients is currently sewing cloth masks for the nurses, and according to the nurses ‚Äúit does 30% of the job, we‚Äôll take what we can get‚Äù.

reply_text:
honeyhiphop:
article saying the reason why we low in supplies, or out is because china bought it all and got it shiipped into there country
Don‚Äôt believe everything you read. That article sounds just as a click bait and not like a reliable source. I wouldn‚Äôt google to prove if it‚Äôs right or wrong but I will give you a couple of question for some critical thinking:
All countries has contracts set up in place on the amount of export and import. Usually they have few chains of suppliers coming from different countries to sustain flow of products in case if there is a political/economical problem with one of the suppliers. That means that they need to honor their deals and they can not just say that let‚Äôs say Australia wouldn‚Äôt get their groceries (or whatever else) just because China decided to buy it. Everyone has contractual obligations.
However supply chains are indeed suffering right now because this products have never been in such a demand and there was a certain amount of stock produced. When everything suddenly got sold out it still takes tome to produce it. And now it‚Äôs not only to produce it but also increase the capacity of your factories to produce higher amount of stock. Which takes time. And we are in the situation where a lot of factories have been stopped not even talking about increasing their production.
I‚Äôm sure China is buying a lot but they are also sending a lot of help including physical goods to other countries that need more help.
So I totally wouldn‚Äôt take seriously that article. Or I would‚Äôve done the research to confirm that info.

coerdelion:
China is now exporting tonnes of medical grade facemasks, since they‚Äôve got the virus under control.
At least that is the official claim.
Here is the problem with trying to rely on social distancing. The invisible viral droplets can hang in the air for hours indoors and others walk through them. It actually isn‚Äôt too effective. And the virus is so small it can easily go through masks so they aren‚Äôt a sure thing either. In hospitals they wear two masks at a time.

hey, I have been having to buy groceries for my whole family as they are in isolation due to coming back from overseas, in Australia anyone returning must self isolate for 14 days. It‚Äôs stressful because the grocery store stopped doing deliveries as they couldn‚Äôt cope with the demand. At the same time you can‚Äôt buy masks or hand sanitizer or rubbing alcohol ANYWHERE! I am just praying for everyone who may be going through something like this, or anything related to COVID-19.
STAY BLESSED, POSITIVE AND SAFE!

Hi there,

Because I‚Äôm an eCommerce product photo editor and image background remover. Most of my clothing brand buyers are importing their dress product from China((COVID-19))! I was just reading that most who get it only have mild flu like symptoms. They do not know why some people die from it but it seems to be an over reaction of some people‚Äôs immune systems in response to the virus. People who work in hospitals, and the elderly or those with less robust immune systems seem to come down with it the worst, although top officials in some countries have also come down with it.
So far in the U.S. there have been 60 confirmed cases in just a few states. Unfortunately people returning from the eastern countries who were exposed to the virus on planes have boarded planes to various destinations around the country. So far the government response has been much less than ideal.

Most goods arrive by ship, so Corona Virus isn‚Äôt an issue. The only issue might be an economic slowdown until a cure is found.
However, people are still buying goods and needing services, so your orders should keep coming.
We should also keep things in perspective.
The CDC estimates that as many as 56,000 people die from the flu or flu -like illness each year. (in the USA)
Corona virus kills a lot less than that, and not everyone who gets it dies from it.

We have just now had it enter the U.S. so no one knows how bad it can get.
Some people who are exposed to it have their immune systems over react to it which then send too many attack cells into the lungs. The die off of cells in the lungs chokes off the oxygen supply.
It is spread when people sneeze or cough. It may also be spread from touching things with droplets on it. Wash hands after touching things in public for 20 seconds at least or use hand sanitizer and do not touch your face eyes or mouth.

reply_text:
I was waiting for someone to start this discussion about COVID-19 virus.
It is affecting and will be affecting a lot of businesses and areas. Already a lot of markets are affected including oil and gas and even manufacturing and phones, TV etc potentially might have higher prices in the next year or so. The impacts are going to be way dipper and extend and after the virus epidemia is done.
I live in one of the countries with highest numbers of sick people but this government handled situation amazingly fast and doing everything to stop the spread. They found all contacts of sick people (which are more than 2000 people that they found and quarantined as a prevention even without symptoms), closed borders (which a lot of people doesn‚Äôt like), made it a CRIMINAL offence to withhold information about your whereabouts and your health condition. Your visas will be revoked and you will be deported from the country if you breached home quarantine. Government will pay all your medical bills if you get sick and if you are in official quarantine you will be compensated 100$ for each day.
But there is no point to panic because of this and just to take normal precautions which should‚Äôve been common sense by now, not to sneeze and cough with open mouth, do not spit on the streets, wash your hands and don‚Äôt touch your face. Seriously it‚Äôs all common sense and governments shouldn‚Äôt be telling us to follow this rules.
We still have more chances to be hit by a car.
But industries will be affected in short and long run.

Also the ones who spread it can have a mild version of it while spreading it to people who will have over reactions to it and possibly die from it. Places like schools, hospitals and jails and prisons are particularly going to be breeding grounds.
As freelancers it‚Äôs possible to stay home and not go to places in public right now until we see how much of our area is going to be affected. So if this gets out of control at least many of us don‚Äôt have offices to go to.

reply_text:
mariashtelle1:
The mask wouldn‚Äôt save you anyway
Not entirely correct. Depending on the mask. An N95 disposable mask (or P2 / P3 for European equivilant) do offer a form of protection, but health officials are cautious to recommend them because most people won‚Äôt use them properly (fitted flush to the face properly at each use) and they‚Äôre not designed for more than short term use. They‚Äôre also a little expensive.
A regular surgical mask does give some degree but the main reason is that is helps protect people when touching their face/mouth (which they do some 23-40 times an hour) - Wearing a mask reduces the risk of transmission, if nominally, as long as you‚Äôre practicing good hand hygeine as well.
As you rightly said, The other benefit is that they also help reduce a person who is infected spreading it further theoretically.
I‚Äôm a bit screwed either way as I have a big beard Time to head to the bunker!!

It spreads very easily and quickly and kills 2 to 3% of those who get it, unlike the flu with only kills .1%. No cures for a virus. This is something unlike anything before it. Things have changed. Hopefully a vaccine will come along for it soon.
Expect to see people wearing masks in public, restaurants closing and who knows what else, on a permanent basis. We all are fortunate who work from home.
Notice that a cruise ship was a place where many caught it. Being in an enclosed area with others is to be avoided if possible. Public transport for example might see a decline. Starbucks stock may take a hit for example. Think of any place where you are around lots of other people.
And apparently people can have it without symptoms and give it to others. How much will people‚Äôs way of life be changed?
It‚Äôs hard to think of any industry not affected potentially. Home renting and buying? Staying in hotels? Did the last residents have it? What about washing your clothing at a laundromat? Going to a library? Fast food restaurants including drive thru‚Äôs?

reply_text:
Throwing in my two cents: Correlation ‚â† causation. It‚Äôs not the virus itself, it‚Äôs the the consequences of fear caused by the virus.
This actually boosts certain types of industries, such as suppliers of emergency goods, while it affects others negatively because consumers are diverting their available funds to those goods, from things of lesser relative importance.
One of my favorite quotes:
Just because you see a turkey flying in a tornado doesn‚Äôt mean turkeys can fly.
In other words: just because you‚Äôre doing well when there‚Äôs a good economy, doesn‚Äôt mean you‚Äôll keep doing well if what you offer isn‚Äôt a critical-to-survival good/service. I‚Äôll admit I‚Äôm exaggerating, but the point stands; people are going to prioritize. This was witnessed during the American Great Depression, and is witnessed any time a noticeable recession occurs in any established economy. Nowadays, being global and digital only means the effects are even more noticed by those who rely on being a global economy like many on Fiverr.
Those who don‚Äôt know history are doomed to repeat it.
Many people seem confused by this event, but it‚Äôs not a new phenomena. (Remember the H1N1?) Yes, there will be victims (the flu still has more deaths-per-year, thus far). Yes, this is something to be attentive to (though you‚Äôd have to be rather socially-starved to be completely out-of-the-loop). Yes, it‚Äôs cause to take a few extra steps to be a bit more safe (if an individual isn‚Äôt already practicing good hygiene). But this IS. NOT. NEW.
The cancellation of events are for the sake of protecting people from themselves, because people will rationalize that going to a massive gathering is more important than their health AND the health of the people around them. (Like some people rationalize that answering a text is more important than focusing on the road. It doesn‚Äôt matter how often ‚Äònothing‚Äô happens, it only takes one time for disaster to occur.)
I should probably get off the soapbox, though. Not sure how I ended up on it, actually. I was only going to make a short comment.

For the U.S. we haven‚Äôt the resources needed. The hospitals were already stretched to their limits at maximum capacity. Food banks, cuts in social services, cuts in Medicare, we have no reserves or planning whatsoever. We‚Äôve only tested a few hundred people for the virus. Test kits are in very short supply. People could only be tested if they had a high fever and cough.
Our main hope is that the virus isn‚Äôt as active when the weather warms up in the spring. I‚Äôm not sure if we‚Äôve ever had nationwide martial law of not but suddenly anything seems possible.

Greetings! Hope you all are well. I‚Äôm here since 2017. Day by day the performance is going well.
But is this year a caution for me? Why?
Because I‚Äôm an eCommerce product photo editor and image background remover. Most of my clothing brand buyers are importing their dress product from China((COVID-19))! Nowadays I think they are in very complex condition. Maybe that‚Äôs why the number of new buyer is decreasing! and I‚Äôm getting less product photos. Though other photo types are going well.
What‚Äôs about your Fiverr category/sector? Is everything going well? Write in comment/reply box.
Thanks & Regards,
reply_text: These are human genes that have received or are given a signal to act according to new situation. The goal is to survive and nothing stops it. It is not a question if half of the planet will be infected, it is a question how soon. That‚Äôs why unprecedented measures must take place. Would be nice to have vaccination before that but it is unlikely. Unfortunately. Markets are going to adapt to new environment indeed imo. Freelance community must do the same. Search new topics where freelancing could be helpful in new situation‚Ä¶

Scam alert
Inserting a scam warning of a different kind than the ones we usually get here - there are already people trying to take advantage of the situation by sending emails, pretending to be from a country‚Äôs main health organization and asking to open an attachment with questions related to COVID-19 which then will install malware on the computer to grab passwords and such. Take care of yourselves, everyone, in many ways, washing your hands doesn‚Äôt help against everything
More on topic, I‚Äôm still getting orders for the moment, including from Chinese customers.

reply_text:
I don‚Äôt have a lot of faith in disclaimers, they can cause two things.
People don‚Äôt order because they don‚Äôt like the disclaimer
People order and ignore the disclaimers
You can set up your gig for 0 revisions, and people can still request revisions.
Fiverr puts too much pressure on the sellers. We‚Äôre supposed to deliver perfect work, 100% of the time. If the client is not happy, we‚Äôre supposed to work with the client until happiness is achieved. It‚Äôs all subjective, and we‚Äôre not protected.
On Uber, if you show up to a location and the passenger doesn‚Äôt show up, you can cancel and collect $3.90. If you pick up the passenger and deliver him, you‚Äôre gonna get paid even if he gives you 1 star. You can also get your money right away if you don‚Äôt mind paying a 50 cent fee. Or send it to Uber‚Äôs debit card without the fee.
I think for Fiverr to get better, they need to learn from Uber and other companies.

There are people here who need their Fiverr earnings to buy food for themselves and their family, to pay their health insurance, rent and other necessities, and of course, they are worried now, especially if they see a drop in their orders and want to find out if everyone isn‚Äôt getting orders anymore either, what they do or plan to do if it is so and continues, and so on.
This is the conversations category, if you hover it in the category lists, you‚Äôll find that it says that it‚Äôs a catch-all for any discussions that don‚Äôt fit anywhere else and for non-Fiverr related discussions and ‚Äúanything else that doesn‚Äôt break the forum rules or other community guidelines‚Äù.

It‚Äôs definitely affecting the orders. Whenever something disrupts the global and regional markets, and there are closures, there is bound to be a decline. Keep in mind, many work has totally suspended or got cancelled, so demand is obviously going to get lower as well. Just because people are locked up inside their homes doesn‚Äôt mean they‚Äôll order more online.
People actually need to go to work and have projects in order to give us work so this will definitely affect us freelancers and it might get worse as more strict protocols and longer shutdowns are in place.
The only silver lining is the hope that the virus might be redundant or less effective as the weather gets warmer. It‚Äôs not a myth, I‚Äôve been reading up and there‚Äôs actual evidence that heat makes it less potent if not totally obscure.

reply_text:
nikavoice:
I‚Äôm curious how much money (per mile) do Uber/Lyft drivers make today? I use to keep up with a few drivers on YT but it‚Äôs been a longtime.
What Uber pays per mile depends on where you are in the USA or in the world. In South Florida, we get $0.62 per mile, $0.12 per minute. I think taxi drivers make $1.25 per mile, $0.25 per minute. Uber drivers make more when they drive luxury vehicles, huge minivans, etc. If there are no surges (extra money for increased demand), I will filter towards long rides, and reject short rides (as long as Uber lets me, they can disable that function if you reject too many rides). If there is a surge, I will drive towards it (if it‚Äôs close) and go online and accept the first ride I get.
A fellow driver tells me his goal is making $100 in 5 hours. Sometimes that‚Äôs possible, other time it‚Äôs not. On average, I make $12 to $15 an hour. It‚Äôs a job that requires patience because the first hour might be horrible, but on the next hour you might get great surges.

I have two orders so far directly linked to the virus, informational documents.
The economy as a whole of course takes a massive hit but people still spend money, just not as much and partly on different things, and more on certain things.
There will be demand for new things/services or more of some already existing things/services, while the world tries to adapt and keep functioning.
Whether someone has work or not, now highly depends on what exactly one does, and if there are alternatives. Here , for example, people who work in restaurants which are empty or closed, are being suggested they could work in farming, as the workers from abroad will be missing, when borders are and stay closed for a while. Money might, also in the long run, in the face of this experience, be diverted to training more health workers, etc.

Sure, but a massive influx of new and inexperienced sellers might work in the favor of those high rated sellers with hundreds of reviews, purely because to a buyer the alternative will seem so far behind. The main threat could be sluggish economic movement which will force businesses to advertise less, delay launches and slow down production.
The next 3-4 months may be slower, followed by a huge resurgence. It is probably a good time for most freelancers to sharpen their swords and work on newer, more polished offerings to capitalize when the market eventually bottoms out.

Greetings! Hope you all are well. I‚Äôm here since 2017. Day by day the performance is going well.

reply_text:
fastcopywriter:
In South Florida, we get $0.62 per mile, $0.12 per minute. I think taxi drivers make $1.25 per mile, $0.25 per minute.
SoFlo is a huge market, I know there are areas like Fort. Lauderdale/Hollywood, Hallandale, Palm Beach, and Miami is a beast of it‚Äôs own. I used to go to the Opa Locka/Hialeah Flea Market, phew that was fun.
fastcopywriter:
A fellow driver tells me his goal is making $100 in 5 hours. Sometimes that‚Äôs possible, other time it‚Äôs not. On average, I make $12 to $15 an hour. It‚Äôs a job that requires patience because the first hour might be horrible, but on the next hour you might get great surges.
$12-$15 is not too shabby. I‚Äôm happy you found something that gives you extra income, it‚Äôs an honest and decent wage. As a driver how are you handling the virus with passengers and such? I‚Äôm sure business will pick up more considering the situation.

reply_text:
What people don‚Äôt understand, is that the prices paid now in terms of the economy make public health worse long-term.
One minute it‚Äôs cool and normal to stockpile sanitizer and toilet paper and close all businesses because of a virus that has negligible effects on 80% of people. However, no one understands that you can only do that once while the economy is as it is. Should a more serious health crisis follow this one, (which diseases do in periods of economic decline) you‚Äôre pretty much done for.
Sadly, we don‚Äôt live in a world of logical long-think. We live in a media and social media world of instant OMG! Coupled with a bit of ‚ÄúI‚Äôm an expert‚Äù because I follow the news.
Don‚Äôt waste your energy arguing, though, you‚Äôll never be allowed to have a logical discussion in times like these. You‚Äôll just be flagged as some kind of human monster because you are not going ‚ÄúOMG!‚Äù yourself.

Malaria has returned to Greece as financial cuts contribute to the re-emergence of a once extinct disease. ‚Ä¶ Other mosquito-borne diseases that have slipped back into Greece include West Nile virus. reply_text:
The pure growth in reaction to this shows the collective anxiety we all have. No one knows the true answers because we have not faced a pandemic like this in our lifetimes. It is hard to see the true ripple effect until well after the recovery from this. Public and personal health will take priority over business right now. Accepting that is important to making it through this.
One of my Gigs was featured as an editor‚Äôs pick to be on the front page of Fiverr. My immediate thought was, ‚ÄúThis is wonderful, but terrible timing because I think this is not a normal operating cycle with such a pandemic and Fiverr, will receive less exposure.‚Äù
I also thought Bernie Sanders would be the next US president. So, what do I know, really?

We do not have ‚Äúpublic health care‚Äù here, or anything close to it. We have public ‚Äúwho cares?‚Äù
I spent a week last year struggling to breath due to someone here mixing bleach and ammonia and at the time had no idea what happened to me to do that. I was literally fighting to get each breath. I know what it‚Äôs like. I wouldn‚Äôt wish that on my worst enemy. I stayed in a hotel for a week just trying to survive. I knew whenever I came inside my home I couldn‚Äôt breath but had to play detective here in spite of that to figure it out. It‚Äôs horrible when you can‚Äôt get a breath.
I understand that is what this disease can do to people.

reply_text:
nikavoice:
As a driver how are you handling the virus with passengers and such?
My father doesn‚Äôt want me to drive, so I‚Äôm going to respect his wishes. One thing I‚Äôve learned is that you can have corona virus, not know it, and be spreading it around.
As for business, I think it‚Äôs going down. A lot of people are staying home, festivals are being cancelled, so demand has gone down.
I imagine demand on Fiverr should increase. A friend of mine works at a bank, and he‚Äôs working from home thanks to covid. School is being cancelled as well, lots of kids are getting homework. Will they be hiring proofreaders? Who knows?

Greetings! Hope you all are well. I‚Äôm here since 2017. Day by day the performance is going well.
But is this year a caution for me? Why?
Because I‚Äôm an eCommerce product photo editor and image background remover. Most of my clothing brand buyers are importing their dress product from China((COVID-19))! Nowadays I think they are in very complex condition. Maybe that‚Äôs why the number of new buyer is decreasing! and I‚Äôm getting less product photos. Though other photo types are going well.

Thanks & Regards,

reply_text:
saaad47:
I‚Äôm 23 and I am Quarantining. It‚Äôs not an over reaction.
People your age are unlikely to catch covid. Also, most people aren‚Äôt self-isolating, Home Depot and local supermarkets have been as busy as ever. In fact, I think some folks are using this opportunity to work on construction projects, gardening, etc.
blavaro:
Furthermore self-quarantine is mainly supposed to stop spreading the infection.
We‚Äôll see if it works. I know kids on Spring Break have been going to the beach even though the governor of Florida closed the beaches. How do you enforce that? Do you put a cop on every beach? It‚Äôs very impractical. In California, they expect people to snitch on lawbreakers, good luck with that. Most people mind their own business unless a crime is commited against them.
Besides, how long do you think people can live like this? Who wants to live a life without restaurants, movie theaters, etc? Who wants to cook every meal at home and overpay for toilet paper on eBay?
People talk about the sacrifices civilians made during WW2, but that was different, and those civilians still had access to movies and other entertainments. It was gas that was rationed, people grew victory gardens, and lived with a lot less. Ironically, there was still a black market, people selling counterfeit gas cards, etc.
Now things are pretty crazy. I read that in New Jersey a family got arrested for inviting more than 50 people to a wedding at home.
On the other hand, in Philadelphia they are delaying arrests of those who ‚Äúcommit certain non-violent offenses.‚Äù So if someone wants to burglarize homes in Philly, this is the perfect time to do it.
‚ÄúDue to the confirmed case of #COVID19 from community spread, Salt Lake City Police Department is asking all criminal activities/nefarious behavior to cease until further notice,‚Äù the Utah capital‚Äôs law enforcement wrote in a tweet. ‚ÄúWe appreciate your anticipated cooperation in halting crime & thank criminals in advance.‚Äù
Why not wish for rainbows and lollypops?

Millennials are not invincible 2. The new data show that up to one-fifth of infected people ages 20-44 have been hospitalized, including 2%-4% who required treatment in an intensive care unit.
Still, the most severe cases, and the highest rates of death, are among the elderly. Although 17% of the U.S. population is 65 or older, 31% of cases were in that age group.
The higher case rate among older Americans strongly suggests a true underlying, biological vulnerability.

saaad47:
Similarly US had about 40 odd cases a few days ago and now US has more than 22K cases.
This is because the USA is actively and widely testing. There may have been only 40 KNOWN cases, but that doesn‚Äôt mean there couldn‚Äôt have already been many more at that time.
22,000 cases seems like a large number, however, in a nation of 330 million people, that‚Äôs only 0.00006% of the total population, and most of those infected right now have minor/moderate cases that do not require hospitalization. Let‚Äôs not overlook perspective in all this. Numbers are useless without perspective.
saaad47:
I hope you get it.
This is a horrendous thing to say to anyone. Wishing that people become inflicted by a dangerous virus is a deeply unkind thing to wish upon anyone.

reply_text:
It‚Äôs a new disease which all of us will come into contact with. It‚Äôs realistic to think we all will get it. One in five of us will need to be hospitalized. We do not have that kind of capacity in our hospitals.
One fifth of our entire country may need to be hospitalized.
fastcopywriter:
Is it fair to shut down society for the one fifth that are in danger?
It sounds like you can‚Äôt grasp the gravity of the situation.
No one has immunity to this disease and it‚Äôs impossible to determine who will be able to throw it off like a case of the flu, and who will become more sick.
We now have a U.S. senator who tested positive, and a governor as I recall. Look at what happened to Italy. We unfortunately can expect that here, no reason to believe otherwise. By shutting things down we might be able to ‚Äúflatten the curve‚Äù meaning not have as high a spike before cases start to go down. It‚Äôs our best hope.
So far we are a long way from the time when cases will start to go down. I wish everyone could realize the importance of at least keeping a distance between themselves and others, and frequent hand washing.
It‚Äôs not just about each of us trying to not get sick. It‚Äôs about having it without any symptoms, and going around where others are and spreading it to them. So even if you don‚Äôt have symptoms you may put others into danger by coming into close proximity to them. This is a common way people get it.
I want to offer a bit of hope as well as this gloomy report:
There is a new drug called remdesivir in testing that so far shows it can actually cure people of corona virus. It is undergoing clinical trials in three places in the US in 1000 patients.
First results are expected in late April.

reply_text:
Most of people can not think exponentially and that‚Äôs why we must use computers to show us the perspective.
Such a perspective shows that if people are not isolated we would simply not have enough ventilators, masks, healthcare workers!!! who could treat the sick people!!!
If we don‚Äôt have doctors and ventilators the mortality will raise. Mortality raised already from 3,4% to 4,2% during last two weeks! It is likely this trend is not age dependant but reflects people‚Äôs responsibility and self-discipline, resp. lack of it.
It is pity that in our country people still think so selfish these days. So government ordered drone and helicopter surveillance, police gives fines in range of thousand dollars to people who still think they are free to potentially spread the virus.
It is also pity how people in our country wear the masks. Some people spent hundreds of dollars for FFP3 masks and wear it when walking outside with their dogs. They still do not understand that FFP3 masks are for doctors, healthcare workers, people in front line who have been tested before and are virus free.
Mindset and mentality is the key to overcome this in my opinion.
