thread_text:
I‚Äôm currently the only person I know in my family or friends group that has covid-19 symptoms. UK testing is pretty much non-existent unless you‚Äôre in hospital, but I‚Äôm 100% sure I have it. Sudden onset persistent, dry cough with pre-flu symptoms? Never experienced that in my life. Would be a mighty coincidence if it‚Äôs anything else.
I‚Äôm worried for the elderly and high-risk folks in my community, but for myself this has mostly just been a surreal experience more than anything else. I only leave my flat to go for a walk around the block and I keep well away from other people. I‚Äôm indoors for 99% of the day. I read the news obsessively to see the status of my home state, where my family still lives. I‚Äôve deep cleaned my flat and watched almost every episode of cold case files.
Thank god we got a nintendo switch as a wedding gift last year and I have a couple jigsaw puzzles arriving in the post soon.
I also have massive long-term projects on the go at the moment with two beloved clients, so I‚Äôm actually living the dream right now work-wise (knock on wood) as I‚Äôve had to take two weeks off of my day job working with kids, so I know have 14 uninterrupted days of VO work.
Anyway how y‚Äôall holding up? Anybody else sick? XOX
reply_text: Hello, do you know if you have a temperature? Headache? Body aches? Fatigue? Have you called a doctor or hospital?

reply_text:
Hope it‚Äôs not COVID-19, and something else entirely. Here‚Äôs hoping, either way, that you get to feeling better soon.
I myself had every intention of going to the gym today but the more the day dragged on, the less I felt up to it. In fact, my sinuses are driving me nuts and my eyes are itchy. I‚Äôm pretty sure my allergies are starting to flare up. I‚Äôm not really self-isolating but really just staying to myself. Luckily, I can really rest because I have no work to speak of anymore. I had a large order come in yesterday and it‚Äôs already done and sent off to the client.
For now, the rest of the day is mine. Thanks to this virus, the school shut down for a week before spring break (by orders of the governor). I had to go in for a short time to get billing done, but other than that, the day is my own
Thinking it‚Äôs time to clear off my table and do some puzzles myself. I bought myself a puzzle at Christmas and I guess I can start working on it. My son and my son‚Äôs friend who lives with us both did their AMI packets for today. So now, they‚Äôre just goofing off. With a dreary day like today, I just want to rest more than I do anything else.
Get well!

thread_text:
I‚Äôm currently the only person I know in my family or friends group that has covid-19 symptoms. UK testing is pretty much non-existent unless you‚Äôre in hospital, but I‚Äôm 100% sure I have it. Sudden onset persistent, dry cough with pre-flu symptoms? Never experienced that in my life. Would be a mighty coincidence if it‚Äôs anything else.
I‚Äôm worried for the elderly and high-risk folks in my community, but for myself this has mostly just been a surreal experience more than anything else. I only leave my flat to go for a walk around the block and I keep well away from other people. I‚Äôm indoors for 99% of the day. I read the news obsessively to see the status of my home state, where my family still lives. I‚Äôve deep cleaned my flat and watched almost every episode of cold case files.
Thank god we got a nintendo switch as a wedding gift last year and I have a couple jigsaw puzzles arriving in the post soon.
I also have massive long-term projects on the go at the moment with two beloved clients, so I‚Äôm actually living the dream right now work-wise (knock on wood) as I‚Äôve had to take two weeks off of my day job working with kids, so I know have 14 uninterrupted days of VO work.
Anyway how y‚Äôall holding up? Anybody else sick? XOX
reply_text:
I‚Äôm absolutely terrified of being sick with anything, so this whole thing has really just made my anxiety skyrocket. I also live with 11 people, which is more than the U.S. President has said to even gather with; what makes matters worse is the two most high risk people in my house (Dad w/ diabetes and Grandma who‚Äôs 74) are both refusing to practice social distancing and still going shopping and not washing their hands (incensed beyond belief at that).
I‚Äôve also been doing a lot more church work since we‚Äôve been doing online church. Pumping out social media posts, videoing children‚Äôs church lessons, and writing Bible devotions have been my days outside of the three hours I reserve for my writing orders (thankfully, business is still going strong).
I hope you feel better, @gwyneth_galvin. Does being sick affect your ability to do VO work at all?

thread_text:
I‚Äôm currently the only person I know in my family or friends group that has covid-19 symptoms. UK testing is pretty much non-existent unless you‚Äôre in hospital, but I‚Äôm 100% sure I have it. Sudden onset persistent, dry cough with pre-flu symptoms? Never experienced that in my life. Would be a mighty coincidence if it‚Äôs anything else.
I‚Äôm worried for the elderly and high-risk folks in my community, but for myself this has mostly just been a surreal experience more than anything else. I only leave my flat to go for a walk around the block and I keep well away from other people. I‚Äôm indoors for 99% of the day. I read the news obsessively to see the status of my home state, where my family still lives. I‚Äôve deep cleaned my flat and watched almost every episode of cold case files.
Thank god we got a nintendo switch as a wedding gift last year and I have a couple jigsaw puzzles arriving in the post soon.
I also have massive long-term projects on the go at the moment with two beloved clients, so I‚Äôm actually living the dream right now work-wise (knock on wood) as I‚Äôve had to take two weeks off of my day job working with kids, so I know have 14 uninterrupted days of VO work.
Anyway how y‚Äôall holding up? Anybody else sick? XOX
reply_text:
So far no. I will keep trying. I can live without the paper goods but so far can‚Äôt get packaged foods.

reply_text:
Me and my mum had been having symptoms too. Pre-flu symptoms, cough and a runny nose. And I‚Äôm kinda sure I have/had it too, since I traveled by local trains and went out to a Gig, etc. And the worst thing, in India people just don‚Äôt care enough. Only 5 in every 100k people have got tested here.
For me and my mum, well we‚Äôve been chugging on a lot of our homemade Ayurvedic drinks, which have done their magic and the symptoms have almost vanished 80% without any external medication.
If possible, try making a hot tea using ginger, cumin, pepper, turmeric and lime.
Something similar to this => https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GNYGtaf0SYI 3

I‚Äôm worried for the elderly and high-risk folks in my community, but for myself this has mostly just been a surreal experience more than anything else. I only leave my flat to go for a walk around the block and I keep well away from other people. I‚Äôm indoors for 99% of the day. I read the news obsessively to see the status of my home state, where my family still lives. I‚Äôve deep cleaned my flat and watched almost every episode of cold case files.
Thank god we got a nintendo switch as a wedding gift last year and I have a couple jigsaw puzzles arriving in the post soon.
I also have massive long-term projects on the go at the moment with two beloved clients, so I‚Äôm actually living the dream right now work-wise (knock on wood) as I‚Äôve had to take two weeks off of my day job working with kids, so I know have 14 uninterrupted days of VO work.
Anyway how y‚Äôall holding up? Anybody else sick? XOX

reply_text:
Ah, @gwyneth_galvin - sorry to hear this. But glad - in a kinda sardonic way - you‚Äôre getting it out of the way early.
My son has it and is self isolating - #2 daughter and I took him a care package of loo roll, washing up liquid, soap and various other bits and pieces, as well as dinner in a vacuum flask thingy tonight. We‚Äôll probably be doing that a lot over the coming fortnight.
Here in Glasgow you cannot get paper goods for love nor money. Soap is in very short supply ‚Ä¶ but not shampoo for some reason. Shelves and shelves of shampoo and conditioner with no one interested in it. At a pinch, you can use that as shower gel and washing up liquid - it all has the same base, apparently.
Luckily, we‚Äôd put some stuff aside for Brexit, which we still have ‚Ä¶ or at least what‚Äôs left of it after Brexit didn‚Äôt really happen that much.
And yes, that EFT tapping for increasing lung capacity is a great idea. EFT for anything is a good idea. I have a tapping round for making sure your system is open to accepting everything you do for yourself, which is really useful.
@graphtersawyer - take a breath, make sure you focus on what you can control rather than the things you can‚Äôt ‚Ä¶ and, if necessary, isolate yourself in your own room as much as possible. Thinking of you.
@creativetie - take good care of yourself. Not easy to be alone and sick.
I like that we are all here for each other in this community.
Love you all!

Here are symptoms:
People may experience:
Runny nose
Sore throat
Cough
Fever
Pneumonia (which means a lung inflammation)
Difficulty breathing (severe cases)
This is the first I‚Äôve heard of runny nose being a symptom which I‚Äôve had for two weeks. I have never had this before. It‚Äôs just today finally getting better. I also had mild chills a few times, and swollen glands in my neck which are now ok.
This list is published by the World Health Organization
I hope it‚Äôs ok that I report some facts as I hear them here.

reply_text:
With schools here shut down, it‚Äôs been nice to relax. Thankfully, the schools‚Äô kitchens are still working and they are providing both lunch and breakfast for kids in our district. Many of them are doing it around the state of Arkansas.
And, of course, I get word that my gym has shut down so I‚Äôll have to do home workouts. When I went to work on Monday to get checks out of the way, I grabbed my little under-the-desk bike. So, as I am sitting here at my desk, I can work my lower body. I plan on getting in a work out every day. Although I am not at high risk, I have a 76YO FIL and my husband has asthma‚Ä¶ They are.
I‚Äôm getting ready to brave the world soon. I‚Äôm going to get some groceries. Might be a good idea to ready my menu for next week as well. No work really to do but one project (another large one). I can get it done today and then I‚Äôll start getting the junk off my weight bench and lift weights.
Everybody stay healthy and avoid even the small crowds. I‚Äôll brave the early morning crowds and I plan to take my kids to the school today but after that, we‚Äôre home.

reply_text:
It‚Äôs nuts. I read about a Teacher who had to go back to the ER 4 times to get tested, and her and her husband, who transports elderly people, had it too. Today they mentioned looking at self swabbing kits. I think that the numbers are so unknown and this has been circulating in the US for so long now. And young people are not taking it seriously. Even though they are less likely to get sick, they can spread it. Until we have a full picture of how bad or not bad it is, we can not make rational decisions. Right now it is preparing for worse case scenarios. We have no real data from tests. We need testing. No real guidance from the Government. State leaders are figuring things out on their own. Where I live they are turning DMV (Department of Motor Vehicle) stations into testing centers. We are about 7 weeks past our first case in the US, and we are just getting testing going. Nuts.
Will everyone get tested if it is free? Non citizens? Will they risk going to the hospital and getting deported? Just my personal thoughts. Frustrating to watch it unfold in slow motion. Miss the days of the 1918 influenza pandemic when you had to wait for newspapers to print information and it took time to learn the latest news. That is a joke by the way.

I only leave my flat to go for a walk around the block and I keep well away from other people. I‚Äôm indoors for 99% of the day. I read the news obsessively to see the status of my home state, where my family still lives. I‚Äôve deep cleaned my flat and watched almost every episode of cold case files.
Thank god we got a nintendo switch as a wedding gift last year and I have a couple jigsaw puzzles arriving in the post soon.
I also have massive long-term projects on the go at the moment with two beloved clients, so I‚Äôm actually living the dream right now work-wise (knock on wood) as I‚Äôve had to take two weeks off of my day job working with kids, so I know have 14 uninterrupted days of VO work.
Anyway how y‚Äôall holding up? Anybody else sick? XOX

I‚Äôm currently the only person I know in my family or friends group that has covid-19 symptoms. UK testing is pretty much non-existent unless you‚Äôre in hospital, but I‚Äôm 100% sure I have it. Sudden onset persistent, dry cough with pre-flu symptoms? Never experienced that in my life. Would be a mighty coincidence if it‚Äôs anything else.
I‚Äôm worried for the elderly and high-risk folks in my community, but for myself this has mostly just been a surreal experience more than anything else. I only leave my flat to go for a walk around the block and I keep well away from other people. I‚Äôm indoors for 99% of the day. I read the news obsessively to see the status of my home state, where my family still lives. I‚Äôve deep cleaned my flat and watched almost every episode of cold case files.
Thank god we got a nintendo switch as a wedding gift last year and I have a couple jigsaw puzzles arriving in the post soon.
I also have massive long-term projects on the go at the moment with two beloved clients, so I‚Äôm actually living the dream right now work-wise (knock on wood) as I‚Äôve had to take two weeks off of my day job working with kids, so I know have 14 uninterrupted days of VO work.
Anyway how y‚Äôall holding up? Anybody else sick? XOX

reply_text:
The virus isn‚Äô a joke. I know someone who is on a ventilator right now. He can‚Äôt climb up a flight of stairs without passing out.
As for me, I‚Äôve been self isolating. I honestly don‚Äôt have any issues with being at home alot. I‚Äôm such a hermit nowadays, just at home doing readings (I work on 3 platforms.) I actually prefer to be alone as opposed to going out alot, except for working out. I miss that lol.
I get my groceries delivered to my house. Haven‚Äôt been to the gym sometime since mine closed. The Strip (I live in Las Vegas) is completely dark and empty. Toal ghost town.
I feel bad for some people - they can‚Äôt handle the isolation. I‚Äôve seen people going crazy over it. Just so bad, this whole thing is unreal. I‚Äôm still happy that I am making some money.

thread_name: Life in corona season with online jobs
thread_text:
Hi all,
Hope you all keeping well and safe at home.
Well now the impact of this deadly virus makes us to sit in home and creating crisis.Countries and cities that go through a long shutdown period will force many out of business for good, especially micro and small firms and others to lay off employees.In this situation Online jobs plays a key role to help people engaged and earn.Online job opportunities offer huge flexibility and provides quality results. Covid 19 pandemic sweeps around the world but we are better equipped to handle the situation by working through online and keeping social distancing.proudly we can say that we able to start recovery process with the effort of each and everyone.
So please all make sure that continuing the health guidance and stay safe and happy.
Thanks,
Salini sasi

thread_name: Corona virus has attacked on gig‚Äôs
frequent_posters: uk1000, misscrystal, rizwanabubakar, jonbaas, mahfuz1212, bodmas, genuineguidance, scribeforyou, titansign, elle_and_co, eoinfinnegan, shabanajabeen, arifulayon1, bushrakaramat, amalps123, gdruma66, mariayasir, daniyal917
thread_text: The corona virus has attacked on the fiverr gig‚Äôs impressions, views and on clicks. Must need to wearing mask on fiverr gig‚Äôs. Stay your gigs at home live safe.
reply_text:
jonbaas:
The metrics are still being accrued, they just aren‚Äôt being displayed. Gigs have not stopped gaining impressions just because the impressions are not being displayed.
Do you really believe the analytics data is stored correctly everywhere in Fiverr‚Äôs databases etc. (eg.in all relevant tables) and that it just can‚Äôt show those values?
Don‚Äôt you think the analytics page just basically took values that were already stored somewhere (like in fields in a particular table or that could easily be calculated from them) and then displayed them (eg. in the graph/as values)?
It‚Äôs not really a ‚Äúdisplay issue‚Äù if it‚Äôs wrong in one or more places in the database. The analytics page wouldn‚Äôt read through lots of data to show one value to the user as it wouldn‚Äôt be efficient.
Why would it take multiple weeks to show a value that is already stored correctly when the code for showing that data in the graph hasn‚Äôt really changed? Where‚Äôs the difficulty in showing a value that is already stored correctly using the method they already had? And if it was correct everywhere in the database, why was it only recent days‚Äô values that started being shown as 0 when the previous days were being shown correctly (before they changed everything to show ‚ÄúN/A‚Äù).
It‚Äôs obviously stored wrong somewhere (if stored at all in that place) in the database and that was what was getting displayed before they changed it to show ‚ÄúN/A‚Äù. And they‚Äôre obviously trying to fix the values somewhere in the database (even if it‚Äôs right somewhere else) or get it to start writing the values correctly somewhere in the database for a seller‚Äôs analytics figures (eg. daily/weekly/monthly totals).

reply_text:
Okay so it was just a ‚Äúdisplay issue‚Äù that caused valid database values that were all stored/totalled correctly to get changed to 0 when they tried to print those values to the screen in their existing code in the more recent days before they changed it to ‚ÄúN/A‚Äù
I don‚Äôt think Fiverr is giving a full enough version of what is actually happening by saying what they have. They‚Äôre saying it‚Äôs a ‚Äúdisplay issue‚Äù just so it doesn‚Äôt seem that big of an issue - but it‚Äôs taken weeks to try and fix and the last post in the ‚ÄúN/A‚Äù thread says it will still be a few more weeks. Values might be getting stored in one place but not in the place needed by the gigs screen - it‚Äôs not stored correctly in the place in the database that that gigs screen reads (eg. the totals - and that could effect other things like the search engine if that also reads those totals).
It‚Äôs obviously not just a ‚Äúdisplay issue‚Äù. It must be stored incorrectly somewhere for it to have shown it incorrectly like they did. Like I said, it would be too inefficient for it to be reading lots of records before showing the monthly/weekly/daily totals for each gig (in the ‚Äúgigs‚Äù page) so it‚Äôs very unlikely to be doing that (it would have to keep re-reading all those tons of records each time you reloaded the page) - instead it will have been using stored values - and they will have recently (before the ‚ÄúN/A‚Äù change) been incorrect (or not set).
Fiverr haven‚Äôt said what exactly has caused this or whether those values/totals for clicks/views etc. for gigs are correct in every place in the database(s) or anywhere else they‚Äôre stored - or explained why a piece of code that was displaying the values suddenly stopped working (what changed apart from the stored data that was used by that code?).

thread_text:
While the virtual world is helping people stay in touch with their friends, families, and colleagues, most people have reported that they miss the physicality of meeting another human being, or being in the same space as them.
For others, the fear of losing their job , being laid off, or not being able to find work is their biggest source of anxiety.
Even the ones who have been lucky to keep their jobs are finding themselves in a situation where they have to clock in many more hours of work than they used to.
All this is adding to the pandemonium the virus has already created, and the big question now is what will get to people first ‚Äì the pandemic, or the fear instilled by it?

reply_text:
To be honest, this poll request isn‚Äôt likely to yield any valuable data. The experiences of each seller are different. I know sellers who are doing just fine during the months of COVID ‚Äì just as they were before COVID. I know some who are even having fantastic sales levels. I also know some sellers who are seeing a slight drop in sales, but nothing noticeably connected to the global pandemic. And I still see countless new sellers (as I have for years) who have no sales at all because they aren‚Äôt doing anything to compete in the marketplace. Sales largely have nothing to do with the coronavirus at all, and everything to do with the seriousness, and the willingness of sellers to be proactive and build their own success ‚Äì no matter what is happening in the world.
Let‚Äôs be mindful that we don‚Äôt fall into the trap of always trying to find something else to blame for our lack of success. If your sales aren‚Äôt at the level you want them to be, then change your tactics, experiment, find new ways to connect with your target customers. Polling other sellers to see how well THEY are doing, isn‚Äôt going to have any effect upon how successful YOU are going to be.

What do you guys think?

Guys, I was reading through all of the people commenting on the bugs since april 28‚Ä¶ so I put on my aluminum hat and started thinking‚Ä¶ because of all this COVID-19 thing, there‚Äôs a lot of people trying to find an opportunity on Fiverr, right?

reply_text: That‚Äôs pretty clever actually and it may be so! I went from 10-15 messages and 5 orders a day to zero messages and zero orders for two weeks and all of that happened overnight (one of the first days of May) It‚Äôs good to also state that April was my best month on the platform so it makes 0 sense why this issue appeared but apparently quite a few sellers are reporting the same thing! Each one of my gigs went from top-3 best-selling to the bottom of the last page overnight and I gotta be honest‚Ä¶ It sucks! I really hope that they fix this as investing 150% of your energy to build a good profile with a solid portfolio and make a brand out there to just get it all flushed down the toilet overnight just sucks. And I was just starting to get a really good amount of orders because I had the reviews, I made my gigs look the way I wanted them to look, I was getting decent impressions and my prices were fair and solid. I even took some steps in expanding my business because it was starting to get hard managing all the orders so I bought a drawing monitor for my cousin and I started teaching him what I do so that he can help me but I guess it won‚Äôt happen. If your theory is right I hope that they fire the dude who suggested this idea. A lot of sellers who were working hard and building their profiles providing amazing services are not getting any orders now since the beginning of May and their gigs are nowhere to be seen and some of them commented in the Forum that they will start to look for alternatives because having zero control over your gig ranking is discouraging. Imagine doing everything perfect - Solid amount of sells, competitive prices, unique service, professional looking gig with a perfect rating and then losing everything overnight without a real reason with 0 certainty if you‚Äôre going to ever get your ranking back after all of the hard work to make everything perfect to stay on the spot that you just lost. It‚Äôs pretty crazy.

hamza1424:
And Fiverr is not taking it seriously
Fiverr is a business. I can assure you, they are undoubtedly taking their business model VERY seriously. It would be bad business if they weren‚Äôt. And, since the search system isn‚Äôt broken, they‚Äôre doing well upholding their chosen business model.
hamza1424:
they earn like million in a month and they can hire some new people so they can provide services efficiently
You do remember that the world is experiencing a pandemic, and millions of workers have lost their jobs, right? Perhaps Fiverr does not have the option of hiring new workers right now ‚Äì especially when existing/remaining workers are staying home, and not able to work at the office like they once did. Just because you view things one way, doesn‚Äôt mean that Fiverr can as well.
Things are what they are. Like any business, you too are going to have to adapt and overcome.

thread_name: These Days I See New Buyers Mostly Who Just Joined in Mar/Apr 2020; Is It For COVID-19 that more people are buying service in Fiverr?
frequent_posters: sabinasattar_17, misscrystal, abirana, anika09, mariayasir, extreme_codian, lenasemenkova, ashwinirao620, j6nyc6, zhaotang, bashir_expert1
thread_text:
Having an issue working for new buyers; because it seems like they have little idea about Fiverr. They come online very less often sometimes you even need to wait for a day to receive feedback from them. Also like after working with you they don‚Äôt give any reviews or ratings maybe they are not aware about the impact of positive reviews on Seller profile?
I can‚Äôt even say that my buyers are not happy with my service, THEY ARE! I came across with one buyer who even gave me a tip after my work delivered but didn‚Äôt leave a review. A person will only give you an extra money as tip when s/he is happy with your work no? But seems like these days Fiverr is busier with new buyers rather than regular buyers. This is what I am facing personally. Anyone else?
reply_text: I am also new, its been 2 months only

I‚Äôve gotten about 75% buyers with new accounts and the other 25% are previous clients. Not much in between lately.
Every morning I get very strange requests from new accounts too that have nothing to do with my gigs. I‚Äôm not sure why anyone would make these requests or what would make them think I would do them but it‚Äôs every morning like clockwork.
Yesterday one wanted me to make her into a mermaid and she wanted to choose the colors of her top and bottom. I can only guess this is some kind of baiting attempt to get my reaction. Someone wants me to say something unprofessional?
I‚Äôm making a pre-made message saying that I only do what my gigs offer. It‚Äôs amazing I have to do this. There are a couple of people playing games lately.

thread_name: Annihilation by COVID-19 and probable remady
thread_text:
" When You Feel Like Hope Is Gone,Look Inside You And Be Strong and You Will Finally See The Truth That Hero lies In You"
- Marish Carey
Oftentime we observe that whenever there a pandemic took place in the world all the people are compelled to suffer through the pain of loosing their loved ones, loosing employment and going through monetary disadvantages. Which ulitimately throws a blow to their psychological stability. Resulting in the familial chaos and even random behavioural changes in some persons. Which is often termed as insanity.
Causes Behind Outspread :
Majority of the world population do not directly contribute to the formation of a chaotic situation like the current CODIV-19 pandemic, but a very few people can be called to be the ultimate responsibles behind it. Exploitation of the natual aroma or the coverage by practicing unimaginable food diet is one of the causes behind it. This is not very new the world has faced but there were famines which destroyed the civilised fabric of the world for several times. Yes, causes behind those things were still can be attributed to few people again because to carry on preventive measures all the governments were required to be prance but the absense of which opened the door for these evilsome disasters to come forth. Though the role of natural calamity can not be ignored at all.
But the entire blame can not be attributed to the handful of people because even after the outbreak of COVID-19 and instead of being fully aware of its preventive measures people are coming outsite, having fight with the implementors of the regulations and ultimately widening the evenue for the virus to come in.
So we can say that it is lack of ‚Äúmorality‚Äù and the ‚Äúsense of Protection‚Äù that is generating the havoc. This kind of situations will again take place as the evidances from the future but amalgamation of awereness and proactive thinking with maorality will help us to reduce its intensity in future.
Roles Of Online Market Places In Situations Of Financial Crisis :
In our age-old days people faced the same situations again and again. They faced the same financial crisis with more severe outcomes.But in current era the situation have completed a full circle with the advent of Information Technology(IT) and its widespread to each and every corner of the world. As blessing of which new marketplaces like ‚Äúfiverr‚Äù have come to us like the blessings from heaven. Earlier people have less employment opportunity. They either had to rely on their employers for their payments and the services but fiverr have changed the entire scenario by providing opportunity to all the sellers to choose their own services and also to generate a handsome revenue online sitting at home. In the current phase it is not possible to go outside for the search of an offline employment due to ongoing worldwide lockdown. But it does not prevent us from generating revenue as we have fiverr with us.Realising ‚Äúthe hero inside me‚Äù, as per the quote, has been made possible by this marketplace. It did not make us to realise that we are really in the lockdown state.
And when it comes to counter the ‚ÄúPsychological Instability‚Äù I would say, it provides us with plenty of work that there is no time to let our psyche turn instable. And the monetary needs are also getting supplemented.
Overall I,being a member of this fiverr communinty,am feeling honoured to get the opportunity to get into the regime, thanks to the team. Due to your effort many of the families are now supplementing their needs and many have turned itno well-off and famous beings just after working with you thus a greatest salute to you.
THANK YOU SO MUCH fiverr AND TEAM
THANKS FOR READING
                                                                                                                  -  Suman Debnath
reply_text: I think it will helpful for us.
